items.title: Is PhysicsWallah’s stellar public debut the turnaround edtech sector was waiting for?
items.summary: PhysicsWallah listed at a 33% premium to its IPO price, and its shares ended Day 1 at a valuation of  ₹44,000 crore (about $5 billion). The stellar debut has given the edtech sector hope after years of funding decline. And its success contrasts with the struggles of rivals Byju's and Unacademy.

items.title: Capital crunch, poor asset quality topple small microfinance institutions

items.title: Good news on US deal once fair and equitable terms are reached: Piyush Goyal

items.title: Life insurers should simplify products, extend rural reach: Irdai's Swaminathan Iyer

Currently, those earning over ₹15,000 monthly are not automatically enrolled in pension schemes. This leaves many without a secure future in old age. The government aims to fill this gap and ensure financial security for all.

items.title: Jan Vishwas Bill 3.0 ready to boost ease of business: Piyush Goyal

items.title: Thermal power capacity addition expected to touch 12 GW this financial year

This anticipated addition aligns with the power ministry's goals and aims to bolster the nation's energy security amidst rising demand and continued investment in renewables by major power producers.

items.title: Global tech rout hits Tokyo: Nikkei dives 3.2%

items.title: The Great Indian inflation bust

This unexpected disinflation offers the Reserve Bank of India room for a potential interest rate cut, though growth and trade deal outcomes remain key considerations.

items.summary: Rules under India’s Digital Personal Data Protection Act have finally been notified. Many companies fear they’re nowhere close to compliant, but a simple three-step audit can reveal just how exposed their operations are and what they must do before the grace period runs out.

items.summary: Bitcoin’s drop below the $90,000 mark has erased its yearly gains, triggering broad crypto sell-offs driven by ETF outflows, rate-cut uncertainty, leverage unwinds and weakening sentiment, raising fears of a deeper correction or crypto winter.

items.summary: Bernstein says Eternal dominates India’s e-commerce through Blinkit and Zomato, leading app downloads, market share, and user growth as quick commerce rises and food delivery becomes a two-player race.

items.summary: The report comes after China pressured the U.S. by cutting exports of rare-earth minerals critical to autos, semiconductors and military equipment.

This new disease-modifying therapy targets amyloid plaques, offering a significant milestone in addressing the urgent needs of early-stage Alzheimer's patients in India. The drug aims to slow cognitive decline, providing more time and improved quality of life for individuals and their families.

items.title: Volume Shocker: MFs add over 1 crore shares to 10 stocks in October, prices surge up to 34%
items.summary: ​Mutual funds sharply increased positions in October 2025, adding over 1 crore shares each to 30 names. These include leading financials, industrials and banks, reflecting broad confidence across sectors and improving market momentum.​

items.title: Held up by a few heavyweights, Sensex rally stands on shaky ground
items.summary: More than two-thirds of BSE-listed stocks have declined since the Sensex hit a new 52-week high of 84,997.13 on 29 October, suggesting that market strength is concentrated in narrow pockets of high-quality, high-liquidity stocks.

items.title: ‘Good news coming’: Piyush Goyal says India–US trade pact close, but only on equitable terms
items.summary: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal hinted at positive developments regarding the proposed India-US trade pact, stating good news is imminent once the deal proves fair, equitable, and balanced. He emphasized that India will safeguard the interests of its farmers, fishermen, and small industries throughout the ongoing negotiations, which have seen six rounds completed since March.

items.title: Sudeep Pharma sets IPO price band at Rs 563-593; issue to open on November 21
items.summary: Sudeep Pharma has set a price band of Rs 563–593 for its Rs 895 crore IPO, which opens on November 21. The issue comprises a fresh issue and a major OFS, with proceeds aimed at capacity expansion and corporate purposes. The company, a global excipient maker with 1,100+ clients, operates across 100 countries.

items.title: Centre wants to rewrite the mining playbook. But states say the changes will cost them thousands of crores.
items.summary: Odisha and Goa warn of steep revenue losses from the Centre’s proposal to cap auction premiums, stalling mining reforms aimed at boosting ore supply and lowering steel industry costs.

items.title: Emmvee Photovoltaic Power makes a flat debut. Should investors stay put or exit?
items.summary: Emmvee Photovoltaic Power's shares launched on Tuesday, maintaining a steady course. Recent fiscal results from FY25 show impressive growth, and the funds generated from the IPO will primarily address debt obligations.

items.title: Piyush Goyal meeting stakeholders to discuss ways to promote FDI, FII
items.summary: Minister Piyush Goyal is meeting investors today. The discussions aim to speed up foreign investment processes. This will boost job creation and bring new technologies. items.title: Maharashtra tops statewise PV, CV sales chart in Q2: SIAM
items.summary: Maharashtra recorded the highest sales for passenger and commercial vehicles in the September quarter. Uttar Pradesh led in two- and three-wheeler sales during the same period. Industry body SIAM data reveals these trends. Western India showed strong performance in passenger and two-wheeler segments. Southern India led three-wheeler sales.

items.title: Civil Aviation Minister Rammohan Naidu pitches for having more freighters to boost cargo segment
items.summary: India's aviation sector is growing rapidly. The Civil Aviation Minister is pushing for more cargo planes and airports. This will help India capture air cargo opportunities. More cargo movement means more jobs. Air cargo volume is expected to significantly increase by 2030 and 2047.

items.title: SC seeks replies from Centre, CBI, ED and Anil Ambani on plea alleging massive fund diversion at RCom
items.summary: PIL by ex-Union Secretary alleges large-scale fund diversion and delayed fraud detection; SC seeks replies from Centre, CBI, ED and Anil Ambani before considering a monitored probe.

items.summary: Faze Three shares surged 11% to  ₹565 on November 18, driven by increased trading volumes and positive market sentiment regarding a potential US-India trade deal. The textile industry anticipates reduced tariffs, which could benefit exports significantly.

items.summary: Bombay Burmah share price rose 11% post the termination of its agreement with MSTC Limited. The decision, effective November 18, stems from an unsuccessful online bidding process. Despite this, BBTC reported no significant operational impact and noted a 4.4% drop in net profit for the Sept quarter.

items.summary: Indian FMCG sector volume growth slowed to 5.4 percent in the September quarter. This was due to GST rate changes. Value growth, however, surged to 12.9 percent. Rural markets continued to lead sales growth for the seventh consecutive quarter. Urban areas are showing moderate recovery, especially in smaller towns. E-commerce remains a key growth driver.

items.title: European shares slide on Fed rate cut worries, tech valuations

items.summary: India's GDP is projected to grow 7.5% in Q2 FY26, driven by investment revival and stronger rural consumption. SBI highlights a missed opportunity for the RBI to cut rates as inflation remains below 4%. The upcoming December policy meeting will be crucial for decision-making.

items.summary: Indian markets may stay range-bound, but stock-specific opportunities are rising, says market expert Neeraj Dewan. With Q3–Q4 poised for stronger earnings, he is bullish on capital goods, infrastructure, defence, ports, and housing finance. Dewan highlights Adani Ports, Mazagon Dock, BEML, Can Fin Homes and PNB Housing, while cautioning on expensive IPOs and selective valuation risks.

items.summary: Financial services are likely to be the first to benefit from any economic revival, said Chakri Lokapriya of LGT Wealth. As growth picks up, credit demand and capital flows typically lead the way, he added.

items.title: PayU gets RBI clearance for unified online, offline and cross-border payment aggregation
items.summary: Mumbai (Maharashtra) [India], PayU, India's leading diversified fintech platform, has received integrated authorization from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) to operate as a Payment Aggregator across online, offline (physical) and cross-border transactions, including both Inward and Outward, under the Payment and Settlement Systems (PSS) Act. This approval enables PayU to offer secure, compliant, and seamless payment acceptance, settlement and cross-border solutions for merchants across channels.

items.title: Indian market expensive but select sectors shine: Vikash Kumar Jain

Vikash Kumar Jain highlights rate-sensitive sectors, consumption, and an out-of-consensus overweight on IT as potential growth areas. He notes that while a global AI stock consolidation could benefit India, a broader correction might lead to multiple contractions.

items.summary: Nifty 50 Trading Strategy: Axis Securities has recommended a Bull Call Spread strategy for Nifty options contracts expiring on 25 November 2025, forecasting a moderately bullish view.

items.summary: India's market is regaining investor interest. Economic data shows strength. Valuations are becoming reasonable compared to peers. Geopolitical worries are easing. While not yet a direct AI boom player, India's fundamentals are improving. Trade deals with the US and EU are anticipated. This shift is making India a more attractive investment destination.

This rise, coupled with a widening oil deficit, overshadowed a slight improvement in the electronics deficit. Merchandise exports also contracted sharply by 11.8% year-on-year, raising concerns about the country's external balances amidst slowing global trade trends.

items.summary: This collaboration is part of Serene’s broader South India expansion strategy, with Kerala positioned as a key growth market due to its large NRI base, higher life expectancy, stronger health indices, and reputation as a retirement-friendly state. The combination of strong purchasing power and cultural readiness makes Kerala a natural hub for world-class senior living communities.

items.summary: For years, consumer platforms have engaged in forced opt-ins, buried opt-outs, and misleading prompts to trick users into sharing more data than they intended. Now, the data privacy rules tighten the screws on this and could force them to rethink

Better compliance with India’s statistics collection law could make a difference.

This pact, though not volume-driven, diversifies India's export base beyond China and the US, focusing on regulatory alignment and high-value sectors like pharmaceuticals and IT services.

items.title: Narayana Murthy pitches 72-hr work week again, backs China's 9-9-6 rule; follow Europe's 10-5-5 rule, say irked netizens

Back in 2023, Murthy's suggestion about a 70-hour work week invited heavy criticism. This year, Murthy appeared to clarify what he meant, saying it should be a personal choice and not a mandate.

Dalal expects range-bound markets ahead, advising investors to focus on growth plus value rather than chasing broad index moves.

items.title: Cameron Brandt sees emerging markets gaining despite US fund inflows

While US equity and bond funds see consistent inflows, emerging markets are attracting attention, with India receiving a notable portion of GEM fund investments. Investors are seeking diversification amidst shifting market dynamics.

items.title: India’s exports to the US recover in October after four-month slump
items.summary: India's exports to the US rose to $6.3 billion in October, marking a 14.5% increase from September, despite broader declines in exports. Overall exports dropped 11.8% year-on-year, with engineering goods and textiles facing significant downturns due to tariffs and weak global demand.

items.title: PhysicsWallah shares soar 13% in debut trade after solid listing pop. Should you buy, sell or hold?
items.summary: PhysicsWallah shares jumped up to 13% in their market debut after listing at a strong premium over the IPO price, sparking immediate interest among investors. While the edtech firm posted robust revenue growth and returned to profit, analysts remain divided, urging investors to balance optimism with caution amid competitive and regulatory risks.

items.title: IAF, French Air Force launch Exercise Garuda-25 to boost joint operational capabilities
items.summary: The exercise features the IAF's Su-30MKI fighters operating alongside French multirole aircraft in complex simulated air combat scenarios

items.title: Japan's Nikkei falls 3% on tech selloff
items.summary: Japan's Nikkei share average experienced its largest decline in over seven months, falling 3% on Tuesday. This sell-off was driven by investors shedding tech stocks, mirroring a sharp overnight drop on Wall Street. The index's fall below the key 50,000 level accelerated the decline as sentiment worsened.

items.title: Kaynes Tech tumbles 6% as 11.6 million shares become eligible to trade
items.summary: Shares of Kaynes Technology India Ltd. fell sharply on Tuesday as 11.6 million shares exited the lock-in period, making them eligible for trading. However, this does not necessarily mean these shares will be sold immediately. The company reported strong quarterly earnings, with net profit rising 102% and a robust order book.

items.title: Bitcoin slips 30% from October peak, hits intraday low of $90,250; Ethereum plunges 40% below $3,000
items.summary: Bitcoin fell more than 5% in the last 24 hours, while Ethereum declined over 6%. Most major altcoins — including XRP, BNB, Solana, Tron, Dogecoin, and Cardano — were down about 5%. Hyperliquid, however, bucked the trend with a 4.24% rise. Overall, global crypto market cap slipped 4.05% to $3.1 trillion, per CoinMarketCap.

items.title: Multibagger stock in making? Groww share price rises over 90% against issue price post listing
items.summary: Groww share price: If the gains in Groww's stock continue, it could soon emerge as a multibagger stock with IPO investors already raking in nearly 94% return on their investment. Groww shares had ended their listing day trade with nearly 31% gains over the IPO price last Wednesday.

items.title: India to gain from US reciprocal tariff cuts on some agri items: Commerce ministry
items.summary: The Commerce Ministry said that while this applies to all trading partners, it creates a level playing field for Indian exporters

items.title: Jefferies starts WeWork coverage with buy call, says 5 tailwinds could push shares 30% higher
items.summary: WeWork India shares saw a significant jump after Jefferies initiated coverage with a buy rating. The brokerage believes the company is entering a multi-year growth phase. This growth is expected to be driven by strong demand for premium flexible workspaces and operational efficiencies. WeWork India is positioned as a leader in the expanding Indian market.

items.title: Earnings season signals early recovery, but markets still driven by bottom-up stock picking: Deepak Shenoy
items.summary: India's Q2 earnings season showed cautious optimism with decent results despite tariff concerns. Corporate capex revival and potential rate cuts are influencing investors, while autos, healthcare, and engineering sectors present attractive opportunities. The market is currently tactical, but sustained trends in healthcare, smaller banks, and autos suggest a potential shift towards broader market strength.

items.title: India bonds hold in tight range ahead of state debt auction
items.summary: Indian government bonds traded in a tight range as investors awaited new state debt supply and clarity on RBI bond purchases.  Yields on longer-duration bonds hit record highs due to supply concerns.  Market participants are paring positions, anticipating rangebound trading unless RBI purchases increase significantly.

items.title: Groww shares nearly double from issue price in just 5 sessions! Should investors still buy the stock?
items.summary: Groww Share Price: Billionbrains Garage Ventures, parent of Groww, extended its post-listing rally, hitting a record Rs 194 after strong IPO demand and rapid platform growth. Analysts cite user scale, low acquisition costs and AUM strength as positives, though valuations and regulation remain risks. Allottees are advised to hold, while others await meaningful corrections.

items.title: Sensex target for 2026 at 107,000? Morgan Stanley makes big prediction
items.summary: Morgan Stanley expects the Indian market to regain momentum by 2026 and has set a bull-case Sensex target of 1,07,000 by December 2026. With a 30% probability, this optimistic scenario assumes low oil prices, favourable global trade shifts, supportive policies, and strong economic growth, which could drive Sensex earnings to grow 19% annually through FY25–28.

items.title: PhysicsWallah shares end with 42% listing gains
items.summary: Stock opens at ₹145 on NSE against ₹109 issue price; surges to ₹162 within minutes on the back of investor enthusiasm

items.title: India power regulator warns renewable projects of disconnection for grid violations
items.summary: Only two generators – including an Adani hybrid project – have achieved full compliance so far, while others have yet to submit mandatory self-audit reports

items.title: GDP growth for second quarter at 7.5% and more due to GST cut led festive sales, says SBI report
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) had projected Q2 GDP growth rate at 7%

items.title: Geopolitical flare-ups, AI crash, tariff shocks to dampen India’s air travel demand in FY26, ICRA says
items.summary: India's air travel demand is projected to see modest growth of 4-6% in FY26 due to external shocks like geopolitical escalations and trade headwinds. Despite this, international passenger traffic for Indian carriers is expected to surge by 13-15%, driven by stronger overseas route momentum.

items.title: Markets bet on slower hikes as Takaichi pushes for caution
items.summary: Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda will meet Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi amid a nine-month low in the yen. The discussion will focus on interest rate policy, with Ueda hinting at a hike and Takaichi urging caution. Investors are weighing dovish government pressure against inflation and economic contraction, making the meeting pivotal for Japan’s monetary direction.

items.summary: A weak American currency, lower crude oil prices and some inflow of foreign capital into domestic stocks failed to support the Indian currency, forex analysts said

items.title: Emmvee Photovoltaic shares list flat at IPO price of Rs 217 on BSE, NSE
items.summary: Emmvee Photovoltaic Power made its market debut on Tuesday, priced at Rs 217 per share. The initial public offering attracted moderate interest, reflecting a cautious appetite among investors. As a leading manufacturer of solar PV modules and cells, the company has demonstrated impressive financial results for FY25. The funds raised will primarily focus on reducing existing debt.

items.title: PhysicsWallah shares make a strong D-St debut, list at 33% premium over IPO price
items.summary: PhysicsWallah share price: PhysicsWallah shares debuted with a significant premium on Tuesday, listing at 33% on the NSE and 31% on the BSE. The Rs 3,481 crore IPO saw strong QIB subscription, though NII participation was weak. The company aims to expand its hybrid model with IPO proceeds funding offline centers, marketing, and acquisitions.

items.title: Rupee falls 8 paise to 88.67 against US dollar in early trade
items.summary: At the interbank foreign exchange market, the rupee opened at 88.67 and slipped to 88.69 level before inching up to 88.68 against the greenback in initial deals, registering a loss of 8 paise from its previous closing level

items.title: Peter Thiel’s Nvidia exit sparks fresh AI bubble fears
items.summary: Peter Thiel’s hedge fund, Thiel Macro, has fully exited its Nvidia stake, selling about 537,742 shares worth nearly $100 million. The move, following SoftBank’s exit, has intensified concerns over an AI stock bubble. Investors are now watching Nvidia’s Q3 earnings as a key gauge of AI demand, while Thiel Macro shifts focus to Apple, Microsoft, and Tesla.

items.title: Paytm shares fall 2% as PE funds offload stake in Rs 1,640-crore block deal: Report
items.summary: Paytm’s parent One97 Communications slipped up to 2% to Rs 1,305 after a major block deal on Tuesday. According to a report, SAIF III Mauritius, SAIF Partners and Elevation Capital offloaded up to 2% of the company’s equity at a floor price of Rs 1,281, about 3.9% below Monday’s close. The sellers will also be subject to a 60-day lock-in.

items.title: Trump buys at least $82 million in bonds since late August, including from Big Tech
items.summary: According to the forms released by the U.S. Office of Government Ethics, Trump carried out more than 175 financial purchases from August 28 through October 2

items.summary: Adani Enterprises Limited won the Golden Peacock Award for ESG Excellence 2025 at the Annual London Global Convention in the Diversity Sector category.&nbsp;

items.summary: The Central Railway's main line connects south Mumbai with the eastern suburbs and interior parts of neighbouring Thane and Raigad districts.

items.title: Q2 winners: Hero MotoCorp, Marico, 8 smallcaps enter Nuvama’s buy list; offer up to 56% upside
items.summary: Nuvama Institutional Equities has identified ten stocks for investors following strong Q2 earnings. Hero MotoCorp, Marico, and eight smallcap companies are on the buy list. These selections are based on robust demand, margin expansion, and healthy order books. Upside potential ranges from 7% to 44%. Investors can consider these opportunities for potential gains.

items.title: SEC tightens grounds for skipping shareholder votes
items.summary: The SEC has revised its review process for shareholder proposals, making it harder for activists to push resolutions on topics like ESG. Companies may now increasingly rely on state-law exemptions, while activists face a more restrictive environment. The impact will depend on Delaware courts, investor priorities, and upcoming legal interpretations.

items.title: AstraZeneca Pharma India shares surge over 3% on new Hyperkalaemia drug deal with Sun Pharma
items.summary: On Tuesday, shares of AstraZeneca Pharma India surged following the announcement of an exciting alliance with Sun Pharmaceutical Industries. Together, they are set to enhance the availability of Sodium Zirconium Cyclosilicate, which combats hyperkalemia. AstraZeneca will introduce this treatment to the market under the name Lokelma, while Sun Pharma will distribute it as Gimliand.

items.title: Sensex slips 200 pts, Nifty dips below 26,000 as D-St turns cautious after 6 day rally
items.summary: Indian stocks opened lower on Tuesday, snapping a six-day winning streak. Both the Sensex and Nifty saw declines as investors adopted a cautious stance. This pullback comes ahead of key U.S. economic data that could influence the Federal Reserve's decision on interest rates next month.

items.title: FIIs trim stakes in GRSE, BDL and 10 more defence stocks in Sept. Why is the firepower lacking?
items.summary: Foreign institutional investors reduced stakes in several Indian defence stocks during the September quarter, citing valuation concerns and slower-than-expected order inflows. Despite this pullback, mutual funds showed increased buying interest, indicating a selective shift in investor preference within the sector.

items.title: Eternal shares to breach Rs 400? Morgan Stanley lists 3 reasons
items.summary: Eternal (formerly Zomato) shares dipped slightly despite Morgan Stanley raising its target price to Rs 427, citing an attractive buying window after a recent correction. The brokerage believes the company's market share gains are positive, with limited downside risk even in a stress scenario. Despite a 63% year-on-year profit decline, revenue surged 183%.

The floor price is set at Rs 2,570 per share. This transaction is estimated to be worth around Rs 4,626 crore. Blackstone previously reduced its holding in June 2023.

Regulatory risks concerning F&O trading and the sustainability of high margins pose challenges for investors.

items.summary: Trump’s tariff rollback on some grocery items is an indication of his administration’s sensitivity to inflation in an all-American political context. Could US politics also make it easier to strike a deal on social security payments made by Indians working there?

items.summary: The intent is to keep the income tax return (ITR) forms simple for taxpayers to ease compliance, he said

items.summary: India’s deal with the US for LPG supplies may look modest on paper, but it could play an outsized role in reviving the bilateral trade relationship. If so, a potentially larger energy import bill would be a price worth paying.

items.title: How Apple is reinventing the iPhone with new materials and record R&D spending
items.summary: Richard Dinh, vice-president and head of iPhone product design opens up about the aluminium used in the latest iPhone, titanium 3D printing, custom microstructures for heat control, &nbsp;atomic-level ceramic bonding, and more… in an exclusive peek into the design and user experience thinking at Apple.

items.summary: Value fashion chains are aggressively expanding into South India, making it their new focus for growth.

items.title: Is Minecraft facing an outage? Gamers report login and server issues
items.summary: Minecraft players are facing server issues, causing frustration among users. Complaints on Downdetector reveal over 250 reports of connectivity problems on Tuesday.&nbsp;

items.title: GST cuts to boost urban demand, especially for packaged food: Marico CEO
items.summary: Marico expects demand to rise as GST cuts lift urban packaged-food sales and rural markets stay steady, said MD &amp; CEO Saugata Gupta. GST disruption and high input costs affected the quarter, but easing copra prices and stable volumes support a firmer outlook.

items.title: India’s clean car push hits roadblock as debate over super credits intensifies
items.summary: The Society for Indian Automobile Manufacturers or Siam has asked the government to increase the super-credit value for EVs to four vehicles from three in the final rules, and stay with two vehicles for hybrids, according to two executives familiar with the discussions.

items.title: How Peak XV's Shailendra Singh is building the firm for the next decade
items.summary: Peak XV, a prominent venture capital firm in India, has achieved over $3.5 billion in exits in the past 24-30 months. As it approaches its 20th anniversary, the firm aims to continue investing in category-defining companies while adapting to evolving market dynamics.

items.title: Welspun taps EY for next big clean-energy stake sale of $100 million
items.summary: Close to a decade after selling its renewables portfolio to Tata Power, billionaire B.K.Goenka’s Welspun World has charted out its next big deal.

items.title: From growth to guardrails: Why NBFCs are reining in loans to MSMEs
items.summary: India's non-bank lenders, like Bajaj Finance and IIFL Finance, are slowing MSME loan growth due to rising credit risks and bad debts. They are shifting focus to secured lending and tighter underwriting amid external shocks, particularly from US tariffs impacting small businesses.

items.title: Patent expiry looms: Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk strategise to defend their top obesity drugs in India
items.summary: At a recent industry summit, executives from Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk unveiled their game plan for tackling weight-loss medications in India. With the patent on semaglutide shortly expiring, both companies are zeroing in on competitive pricing and broadening their market presence while addressing the challenge posed by generic alternatives.

items.title: Oil PSUs ink deal to buy US LPG: First such pact for importing 2.2 MTPA of gas; move to cut India’s reliance on Gulf
items.summary: India has secured its first annual cooking gas deal with the United States. This agreement aims to diversify supply sources and reduce dependence on Gulf nations. The move also supports India's commitment to increasing energy purchases from the US. This strategic shift is set to bolster energy security and rebalance trade relations.

items.title: Apple sales growth in India at 6-year low of 18%
items.summary: Apple's India sales grew 18% to ₹79,378 crore in the last fiscal year, marking its slowest growth in six years due to a larger base and increased sales of older iPhone models. Despite this, Apple India's net profit surged 16% to ₹3,196 crore, and the company became the fourth-largest market for Apple globally.

items.title: Activists Call Fifth Third’s Deal for Comerica ‘Flawed’
items.summary: HoldCo Asset Management LP is demanding that Comerica Inc. release additional details on its deal to be acquired by Fifth Third Bancorp, calling the sale process “flawed” ahead of a shareholder vote in early January.

items.title: Novo Nordisk cuts Wegovy price, plans to launch oral weight-loss pill in US market — All we know
items.summary: Novo Nordisk plans “all in” launch of Wegovy pill in the US market and will cut price of the drug's injectable option in the country, in line with a deal with the Trump administration. Here's the new prices, and other details.&nbsp;

items.title: Fed’s Lisa Cook Contests ‘Baseless’ Mortgage Fraud Case to Bondi
items.summary: Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook’s legal team offered a detailed rebuttal to mortgage fraud allegations made by President Donald Trump and other US officials, arguing in a new letter to Attorney General Pam Bondi that the claims “fail on even the most cursory look at the facts.”

items.title: US-India trade deal: Phase one of bilateral trade agreement almost complete, will address 50% tariffs, market access
items.summary: Phase one of the India-US bilateral trade agreement is nearing completion and will address President Donald Trump's 50% duties on Indian exports, besides resolving market access issues. The second phase will take some more time, Commerce Secretary said.

items.title: Compass-Backed Lugano Files for Bankruptcy After Ex-CEO Sued
items.summary: Lugano Holdings Inc., an operator of high-end jewelry boutiques owned by Compass Diversified, has filed for bankruptcy months after it accused its former chief executive of stealing millions of dollars from the business and misrepresenting investment deals with high net worth clients.

items.title: India imposes five-year anti-dumping duty on liquid epoxy resins imports from China and three other countries
items.summary: India has imposed a five-year anti-dumping duty on liquid epoxy resins. This measure targets imports from China, Saudi Arabia, Taiwan, and South Korea. The government aims to protect domestic producers from low-priced imports. This action follows an investigation into unfair pricing practices. The duty seeks to ensure fair competition and stable pricing for essential manufacturing inputs in the Indian market.

items.title: Google, Meta Delay Red Sea Cables as Security Risks Rattle Plans
items.summary: Multiple subsea internet cables slated to run through the Red Sea are yet to complete as planned, as political tensions and heightened security threats have made the route more dangerous and complicated for commercial vessels.

items.title: 16th Finance Commission submits report to President Droupadi Murmu
items.summary: The Sixteenth Finance Commission has presented its tax division recommendations to President Droupadi Murmu. The report outlines how the tax pool will be shared between the Centre and states for five years starting April 1, 2026. It also details the formula for distributing taxes among states. The commission visited all states and Union Territories.

items.title: Textile, apparel exports witness double-digit decline in October
items.summary: US tariffs have significantly impacted India's textile and apparel exports, with a 12.9% year-on-year decline in October across most categories.  Exporters are facing order cancellations, discounts, and reduced volumes due to the 50% tariff imposed by the US, which accounts for 28% of India's exports in this sector.

items.title: I-T return forms, rules under simplified Income Tax Act, 2025 to be released by January 2026
items.summary: The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) will release simplified Income Tax return forms and rules for the new Income Tax Act, 2025, by January 2026. Chairman Ravi Agrawal assured that budgeted income tax collection targets will be met, attributing refund delays to system-flagged high-value transactions and ongoing analysis of claims.

items.title: Financial sector to aid next phase of transformation, says DEA secy Anuradha Thakur
items.summary: Economic Affairs Secretary Anuradha Thakur highlighted the financial sector's crucial role in India's economic transformation and sustained growth. She emphasized joint government-private action to strengthen the corporate bond market, expand investment trusts, and boost municipal bonds.  Thakur also noted significant structural shifts including the financialization of savings, a move away from bank-dominated credit, and increased equity market participation.

items.title: India-US trade pact: First stage 'nearing closure'
items.summary: India and the US are nearing closure on the first tranche of a bilateral trade agreement aimed at addressing significant tariffs on Indian goods. This package, focusing on reciprocal tariffs, is expected soon, while broader negotiations continue. India is also advancing free trade agreement talks with the EU, Peru, Chile, New Zealand, and ASEAN.

items.title: Goods exports down 11.8% in October, trade deficit widens on gold imports
items.summary: October brought a challenging scenario for India's economy, with merchandise exports declining 11.8% compared to last year, landing at $34.4 billion. Meanwhile, imports experienced a notable uptick of 16.6%, pushing them to $76.1 billion, primarily fueled by increased gold and silver transactions. This shift resulted in a trade deficit ballooning to $41.7 billion.

items.title: Unemployment rate steady at 5.2% in October
items.summary: As of October, India's unemployment rate remained stable at 5.2%, with significant shifts in the job market—rural unemployment declined, while urban joblessness increased. The labour force participation rate climbed to a robust 55.4%, thanks to heightened engagement from men across various regions. Additionally, a small reduction was noted in youth unemployment, hinting at potential improvements for the future workforce.

items.title: India's sugar output rises 48% y/y as more mills begin crushing
items.summary: A total of 325 sugar mills across the country have started operations so far, up sharply from 144 mills operating during the corresponding period a year earlier

items.title: 16th Finance Commission submits reports to President Murmu; to be tabled in Winter Session of Parliament
items.summary: The 16th Finance Commission, led by Arvind Panagariya, has submitted its report to President Droupadi Murmu. The panel recommends the share of net central taxes for states from April 1, 2026, to March 31, 2031. This crucial report will be presented in Parliament soon. The commission analyzed finances and consulted widely.

items.title: India to gain from US reciprocal tariff cuts on some agri items: Commerce ministry
items.summary: India anticipates gains as the US removes reciprocal tariffs on key agricultural exports. Products like tea, coffee, and spices will now face a level playing field. This move is expected to boost Indian exporters. While some analysts suggest the gains might be modest, the exemptions are seen as a positive development for India's trade.

items.summary: The commerce ministry is finalizing detailed guidelines for the Rs 25,060 crore Export Promotion Mission, set to be released this month. Approved for six years starting 2025-26, the mission aims to support exporters facing high US tariffs through sub-schemes like Niryat Protsahan and Niryat Disha. Priority will be given to sectors like textiles and leather impacted by global tariff escalations.

items.title: Gold imports jump threefold to record USD 14.72 bn in Oct
items.summary: India's gold imports reached a record USD 14.72 billion in October. This surge was mainly due to higher festival and wedding demand. items.title: Energy Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Oil prices hit a rough patch last week, falling back in line with broader financial markets. Prices did try to inch higher, but experienced selling pressure at highs.

items.title: Precious Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Gold fell to the lowest level in a month primarily as the dollar rose against its major crosses and better-than-expected economic number from the US.

items.title: Base Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Base metals traded choppy last week, with prices hitting multi month highs at the start of the week and followed by some profit taking on back of volatility in the dollar and mixed data signals from China and US.

items.title: Flipkart records highest-ever single day sale, grosses $200mn
items.summary: This is the biggest ever single day sale for Bangalore-based Flipkart, since the time the company started in 2007.

items.title: Subramanian Swamy seeks ban on import of cement from Pakistan
items.summary: "Allowing imports of cement from Pakistan, therefore, carried with it the additional risk in that it provides an effective cover for smuggling of contraband goods and harmful weapons and ammunition concealed in cement bags which comes in rakes and trucks, in the hands of disruptionist elements," he said.

items.title: Moneycontrol Exclusive: Govt plans overhaul of tax administration for smooth GST rollout
items.summary: The government has readied plans for a major change in India’s tax administration structure, including overhauling the Central Board of Excise and Customs (CBEC) to ensure a glitch-free roll-out of a nation-wide goods and services tax (GST).

items.title: Sensex, Nifty wobbly; Hind Zinc, SBI, Force Motors most active
items.summary: Asian Paints, SBI, Tata Motors, HUL and Maruti Suzuki are top gainers while ONGC, Axis Bank, MM, Bajaj Auto and Hero MotoCorp are major losers in the Sensex.

items.title: Uber  redBus partner with ixigo for train travellers
items.summary: ixigo, India’s leading mobile travel marketplace has announced partnerships with Uber and redBus to enable instant bookings for cabs and buses natively within ixigo trains app.

items.title: Workload in IT to come down due to AI; jobs to reduce: Genpact
items.summary: But along with that the employment growth rates have started to dip, NV 'Tiger' Tyagarajan says. The percentage addition of employees in India will not be same as past. And due to advancements, a workforce with higher skill sets is required for the IT industry, he says.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Up over 200% in 1 year, what's buzzing with Borosil Glass?
items.summary: Shares of Borosil Glass Works have increased threefold over the past one year as the company has posted strong revenue and EBIDTA growth over the past few quarters.

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns
items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
